page.title: 16INTERVIEW IN S.HARRIS
page.content: {Q}_Who started off this work? {A}_Lord Leverhulme who came from Port Sunlight.He died in 1925 before all his work was completed. If he had lived Leverburgh would have been a big town by now. {Q}_How many people were employed? {A}_Over 200 <men and women>. {Q}_What are the railway tracks on the pier? {A}_Wagons were used to carry heavy stones from the quarry to build the pier. {Q}_Did you work at the pier? {A}_Yes.When I left school at 14 I got a job but Lord Leverhulme died 3 months later and the work stopped. I was paid 4 pennies an hour. {Q}_Would you like to live in the next century? {A}_No.I would rather have lived when I did.
